The Chronicle of the Buddha Vipassī
“After Phussa,
the supreme two-footed being, the Sambuddha,
was the one named Vipassī,
who arose in the world, the Visionary.
Having shattered all ignorance,
he attained supreme Awakening;🔽he went forth to Bandhumati City
to set rolling the Wheel of Dhamma.
Having set rolling the Wheel of Dhamma,
the Leader caused both to be enlightened;
it cannot be expressed in numbers
how many there were in the first assembly.
Then later, the one of immeasurable fame,
he revealed the Truth there;
of the eighty-four thousand
there was the second assembly.
Eighty-four thousand
went forth under the Sambuddha;
to those who had attained the sphere of Ārāma,
the Visionary taught the Dhamma.
While he was speaking in every way,
listening, they were seated nearby;
they too went to the foremost Dhamma,
there was the third assembly.
There were three assemblies
of the great seer Vipassī,
of those whose defilements were exhausted, who were spotless,
whose minds were peaceful, who were well liberated.
